meanings.definition: A document issued by a government, allowing the holder to travel to foreign countries.
meanings.sent1: My passport has my picture and personal information.
meanings.sent2: She showed her passport to the customs officer at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The passport looked like a tiny book filled with adventure possibilities.
meanings.sent4: His passport was his ticket to explore the world beyond his home.
meanings.sent5: Carrying a passport is essential for international travel.

meanings.definition: To grant permission for someone to pass through a place or enter a country.
meanings.sent1: The security officer will passport you through the gate.
meanings.sent2: The immigration officer will passport the visitors at the border.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly said he could passport people through walls.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to passport him into her inner circle.
meanings.sent5: The key to the secret garden was said to passport those with pure hearts.
